channel.title: OMFG Mortal Kombat: Rebirth
channel.description:
[center][u][size=18pt][b]Mortal Kombat: Rebirth[/b][/size][/u] [i][b]A new Mortal Kombat movie is coming?...[/b][/i][/center]
[hr]
[center][size=14pt][u][i]Origin and Background:[/i][/u][/size][/center]
[center][img]http://www.screenhead.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/01/mortal_kombat_logo.png[/img] [img]http://ui13.gamespot.com/2444/mk3ss02_2.png[/img][/center]
Some of you may remember the most epic game of all time, and some of you may as well have not been born if you haven't heard of it. Mortal Kombat is obviously a combat game that originated on SNES and SEGA, iirc. It was the first and best fighting game I've ever played.
[hr] [center] [size=14pt][u][i]Further Production:[/i][/u][/size][/center]
After the success with the video game, movies were made. Both of them were amazing, probably two of my favorite movies, and not just because they were about Mortal Kombat. The concept and way the movie was filmed was incredibly interesting. [center][img]http://www.movieprop.com/tvandmovie/reviews/mortalkombat.jpg[/img][img]http://www.totalmortalkombat.com/multimedia/mk_dvd/usa_mka.jpg[/img][/center]
[hr]
[size=14pt][u][i]The Big News:[/i][/u][/size]
Just recently, a trailer for a potentially "new" Mortal Kombat film has been posted on Youtube. From the looks of it, it's based on modern times with the characters in a suburban city setting rather than the original science fiction wasteland setting.
There's a catch though. The trailer isn't official, nor is it connected with production at the moment. It was made in order to get producers interested in making the film. It's a concept mastermind that has already managed to get over 2.6 million views on Youtube in less than a week. By the looks of it, it's pretty promising.
The video "short", as it's called, is located at this link: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9_MqZn7E-mk&feature=topvideos
The Youtube channel is located here: http://www.youtube.com/user/MortalKombatRebirth
The channel has gotten the following Youtube awards so far:
[ul][li][img]http://s.ytimg.com/yt/img/icn_award_17x24-vfl10931.gif[/img][url=http://www.youtube.com/channels?p=1&s=ms&gl=&t=w&g=0]#1 - Most Subscribed (This Week)[/url][/li] [li][img]http://s.ytimg.com/yt/img/icn_award_17x24-vfl10931.gif[/img][url=http://www.youtube.com/channels?p=1&s=ms&gl=&t=m&g=0]#19 - Most Subscribed (This Month)[/url][/li] [li][img]http://s.ytimg.com/yt/img/icn_award_17x24-vfl10931.gif[/img][url=http://www.youtube.com/channels?p=1&s=mv&gl=&t=w&g=0]#8 - Most Viewed (This Week)[/url][/li][/ul]

item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

[quote=“casey., post:3, topic:343603”]old[/quote]Fuck off, I said it’s 5 days old.

[quote=“the elve age, post:4, topic:343603”]This is a teaser trailer isn’t it? Meaning its not going to come into reality?[/quote]No, it’s more of a “prove you have a good concept and maybe producers will sign for it”.

[center][size=18pt]Mortal Kombat: Rebirth[/size]
A new Mortal Kombat movie is coming?..[/center]

[hr]

[center][size=14pt]Origin and Background:[/size][/center]

[center] [/center]

Some of you may remember the most epic game of all time, and some of you may as well have not been born if you haven’t heard of it. Mortal Kombat is obviously a combat game that originated on SNES and SEGA, iirc. It was the first and best fighting game I’ve ever played.

[hr]
[center]
[size=14pt]Further Production:[/size][/center]

After the success with the video game, movies were made. Both of them were amazing, probably two of my favorite movies, and not just because they were about Mortal Kombat. The concept and way the movie was filmed was incredibly interesting.
[center][/center]

[hr]

[size=14pt]The Big News:[/size]

Just recently, a trailer for a potentially “new” Mortal Kombat film has been posted on Youtube. From the looks of it, it’s based on modern times with the characters in a suburban city setting rather than the original science fiction wasteland setting.

There’s a catch though. The trailer isn’t official, nor is it connected with production at the moment. It was made in order to get producers interested in making the film. It’s a concept mastermind that has already managed to get over 2.6 million views on Youtube in less than a week. By the looks of it, it’s pretty promising.
